title: modern ultra condensed blackletter inspired - custom ?
content:
Hello,  
any idea if this is a full custom work or a commercial font ?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [daho.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402035205/http:/typophile.com/files/daho.jpg) | 32.95 KB |
author: absynthe

comments.content:
I think it has a strong resemblance in general style and shape to a freeware font called Luxembourg (see the sample [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402035205/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script03Pg5.html) near the end of page). Based on this, I would guess this is a custom work, but I would be interested if anyone knows more.

- Mike Yanega

The general feel makes me think of [Rian Hughes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402035205/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Rian%20Hughes)' [Miserichordia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402035205/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=DET0000222).

The "St Etienne Daho" font sample come from a cover sleeve of an EP by french singer Etienne Daho in 1995. Artwork was done by Me Company (background picture credit go to Pierre & Gilles). Does Rian Hughes had any relation with Me Company at this period ? As you said Bald Condensed, the general feel makes you think of Miserichordia, well some other fonts he made give me that feeling too.
